AddWorkspace.BadWikiHtml: Failed to create a wiki from this HTML file
AddWorkspace.CanNotLoadList: Can't load repository list, network connection is not good.
AddWorkspace.CustomServerUrlDescription: Base URL of the OAuth server (e.g., http://127.0.0.1:8888)
AddWorkspace.FilterExpressionHelp: One TiddlyWiki filter expression per line; any match will be saved to this workspace. For example: [in-tagtree-of[Calendar]!tag[Public]]
AddWorkspace.GitDefaultBranchDescription: The default branch of your Git, Github changed it from master to main after that event
AddWorkspace.GitEmailDescription: Email used for Git commit records, used for counting daily commits on services such as Github
AddWorkspace.GitTokenDescription: The credentials used to log in to Git. Will expire after a certain period of time
AddWorkspace.GitUserNameDescription: The account name used to log in to Git, note that it is the name part of your repository URL
AddWorkspace.IncludeTagTreeHelp: When enabled, tiddlers whose tag (or tag's tag, recursively) matches this sub-wiki's tag will also be saved to this sub-wiki
AddWorkspace.IncludeTagTreeHelpForMain: When checked, any label whose parent label (at any level...) is this one will be categorized into this workspace.
AddWorkspace.LocalWorkspaceDescription: Only use locally, fully control your own data. TidGi will create a local git backup system for you, allowing you to go back to the previous versions of tiddlers, but all contents will be lost when the local folder is deleted.
AddWorkspace.LogoutToGetStorageServiceToken: Log in to the online storage service to obtain latest credentials
AddWorkspace.MainPageReloadTip: <0><0>Try:<1><0>Click <2>Reload</2> button below or press <5>CMD_or_Ctrl + R</5> to reload the page.</0><1>Check the <2>Log Folder</2> to see what happened.</1><2>In the worst case you can still copy to backup the folder on your computer, right click on the workspace icon and select Delete Workspace, then re-import the folder on your computer (or import the previously backed up HTML version of the wiki by dragging the HTML in).</2></1></0></0>
AddWorkspace.MainPageTipWithSidebar: <0>Click </0><1>+</1><2> button on the sidebar to start using TiddlyWiki!</2>
AddWorkspace.MainPageTipWithoutSidebar: <0>Click Workspaces > Add Workspace<0> on the menu, or Click Here<2> to start using TiddlyWiki!
AddWorkspace.MainWorkspaceDescription: Contains TiddlyWiki's configuration files and public content when published as a blog.
AddWorkspace.OmitMoreResult: The list only shows the first {{loadCount}} results
AddWorkspace.StartUsingTemplateToCreateWiki: Start creating a wiki with templates
AddWorkspace.SubWorkspaceDescription:
It must be attached to a main repository, which can be used to store private content, Note two points: the sub-knowledge base cannot be placed in the main knowledge base folder; the sub-knowledge base is generally used to synchronize data to a private Github repository, which can only be read and written by me, so the repository address cannot be the same as the main knowledge base.
The sub-knowledge base takes effect by creating a soft link (shortcut) to the main knowledge base. After the link is created, the content in the sub-knowledge base can be seen in the main knowledge base.
AddWorkspace.SubWorkspaceOptionsDescriptionForMain: Configure which tiddlers this main workspace prioritizes. When a tag is set, new tiddlers with this tag will be saved to the main workspace instead of sub-workspaces
AddWorkspace.SubWorkspaceOptionsDescriptionForSub: Configure which tiddlers are saved to this sub-workspace. New tiddlers with the specified tag will be saved here
AddWorkspace.SwitchCreateNewOrOpenExisted: Switch to create a new or open an existing WIKI
AddWorkspace.SyncedWorkspaceDescription: To synchronize to an online storage service (such as Github), you need to login to a storage service or enter your login credentials, and have a good network connection. You can sync data across devices, and you still own the data when you use a trusted storage service. And even after the folder is accidentally deleted, you can still download the data from the online service to the local again.
AddWorkspace.TagNameHelp: Tiddlers with this Tag will be add to this sub-wiki (you can add or change this Tag later, by right-click workspace Icon and choose Edit Workspace)
AddWorkspace.TagNameHelpForMain: New entries with this tag will be prioritized for storage in this workspace.
AddWorkspace.TagNameInputWarning: ⚠️ Please press Enter to confirm tag input
AddWorkspace.ThisPathIsNotAWikiFolder: The directory is not a Wiki folder "{{wikiPath}}"
AddWorkspace.UseFilterHelp: Use filter expressions instead of tags to match entries and determine whether to save them in the current workspace.
AddWorkspace.WikiExisted: Wiki already exists at this location "{{newWikiPath}}"
AddWorkspace.WikiNotStarted: Wiki is not started or not loaded
AddWorkspace.WorkspaceFolderNameToCreate: The name of the new workspace folder
AddWorkspace.WorkspaceUserNameDetail: The editor name used in the Wiki will be fill in the creator field when the Tiddler is created or edited. The editor name set in the workspace will override the global default editor name assigned in the preferences. This allows you to create Tiddlers with different identities in the same Wiki, with multiple workspace configed with different user name.

Dialog.CantFindWorkspaceFolderRemoveWorkspace:
Cannot find the workspace folder that was still there before! 
The folders that should have existed here may have been removed, or there is no wiki in this folder! 
Do you want to remove the workspace?
Dialog.FocusedTiddlerNotFoundTitleDetail: You can install the FocusedTiddler plugin in CPL.
Dialog.NeedCorrectTiddlywikiFolderPath: The correct path needs to be passed in, and this path cannot be recognized by TiddlyWiki. Name: {{name}} , Path: {{wikiFolderLocation}}
Dialog.PathPassInCantUse: The path passed in cannot be used
Dialog.ReportBugDetail: If you have read the tutorial, and carefully read the error output text, and wisely check your input, you can click on the button.
Dialog.RestartMessage: You need to restart the app for this change to take affect.
Dialog.StorageServiceUserInfoNoFound: Your storage service's UserInfo No Found
Dialog.StorageServiceUserInfoNoFoundDetail: Seems you haven't login to Your storage service, so we disable syncing for this wiki.
Dialog.WorkspaceFolderRemoved: Workspace folder is moved or is not a wiki folder

EditWorkspace.AddExcludedPlugins: Enter the name of the plugin you want to ignore
EditWorkspace.AddExcludedPluginsDescription: You can search for installed plugins in the current wiki, or enter any plugin name.
EditWorkspace.BackupOnIntervalDescription: When enabled, data will be automatically backed up with local Git at regular intervals (interval in global settings), so that even if no cloud git synchronization address is configured, it will be automatically backed up locally.
EditWorkspace.EnableFileSystemWatchDescription: Automatically watch for external file changes and sync to the wiki. This is an experimental feature and may have bugs. You can disable it if you encounter issues. Requires workspace restart to take effect.
EditWorkspace.EnableHTTPAPIDescription: Allow third-party programs such as TidGi-Mobile, Tiddlywiki-Collector webclipper, etc. to read and modify your notes through the HTTP network interface.
EditWorkspace.EnableHTTPSDescription: To provide secure TLS encrypted access, you need to have your own HTTPS certificate, which can be downloaded from the domain name provider, or you can search for free HTTPS certificate application methods.
EditWorkspace.ExcludedPluginsDescription: When starting the wiki as a blog in read-only mode, you may want to not load some editing-related plugins to reduce the size of the first-loaded web page, such as $:/plugins/tiddlywiki/codemirror, etc. After all, the loaded blog does not need these editing functions.
EditWorkspace.HTTPSCertPathDescription: The location of the certificate file with the suffix .crt, generally ending with xxx_public.crt.
EditWorkspace.HTTPSKeyPathDescription: The location of the private key file with the suffix .key.
EditWorkspace.HibernateDescription: Save CPU usage, memory and battery. This will disable auto sync, you need to manually commit and sync to backup data.
EditWorkspace.IgnoreSymlinksDescription: Symlinks are similar to shortcuts. The old version used them to implement sub-wiki functionality, but the new version no longer needs them. You can manually delete legacy symlinks.
EditWorkspace.LastNodeJSArgv: Command line arguments from the latest startup
EditWorkspace.MoveWorkspaceTooltip: Move workspace folder to a new location. The wiki will be stopped before moving to prevent file lock issues.
EditWorkspace.Name: Workspace Name
EditWorkspace.NameDescription: The name of the workspace, which will be displayed on the sidebar, can be different from the actual folder name of the Git repository in the workspace
EditWorkspace.NoRevert: Caution! This operation can't be reverted.
EditWorkspace.PathDescription: Location of your local wiki folder.
EditWorkspace.ReadOnlyModeDescription: Can be used with intranet penetration, allowing TidGi work as a server program  to deploy blogs. After opening, wiki can only be modified by directly modifying the file on the disk  (including using git synchronization). The content cannot be modified on the web page, but anyone can access it.
EditWorkspace.SyncOnIntervalDescription: When on, it will automatically sync according to the time interval in the global settings, and will still automatically sync on startup, or manually by clicking the button. Will auto backup data to local git before sync. If turned off, there is only one automatic sync when the application is opened, and one manual sync when the user triggers it by clicking the sync button in the wiki.
EditWorkspace.SyncOnStartupDescription: Commit and Sync once the app cold start.
EditWorkspace.TokenAuthAutoFillUserNameDescription: This feature requires userName to be filled in global setting or workspace setting, if its empty, a default one will be auto filled into workspace setting, you can change it later.
EditWorkspace.TokenAuthCurrentTokenDescription: This token is confidential, which needs to be regenerated after being leaked to a hostile entity, and credentials need to be updated for connected third-party applications after regeneration
EditWorkspace.TokenAuthCurrentTokenEmptyText: Click the Generate button to generate a new credential
EditWorkspace.TokenAuthDescription: When enabled, credentials need to be included in the HTTP request to read write to your knowledge base, which prevents other people in the same LAN from accessing notes, so improves server security. Cannot be turned on at the same time as read-only mode.
EditWorkspace.UploadOrSelectPathDescription: Click the upload button to submit the file to Taiji for storage, or click the select path button to select the file from your storage location.
EditWorkspace.WikiRootTiddlerDescription: Wiki's root tiddler determines the core behavior of the system, please read the official documentation to understand before modifying

Error.ALreadyExistErrorDescription: A folder already exists at this path, and a new knowledge base cannot be created here.
Error.CopyWikiTemplateErrorDescription: E-3 Attempt to copy or overwrite the latest wiki template to the corresponding location, but failed. This should be caused by your input.
Error.DoubleWikiInstanceErrorDescription: E-4 You started the same Wiki twice. This may be caused by a bug in the program.
Error.HTMLCanNotLoadError: Current HTML file path can't be used.
Error.HTMLCanNotLoadErrorDescription: Please enter a path to a valid tiddlywiki.html file.
Error.InitWikiGitErrorDescription: E-1 The template used by the new note repository failed to copy or the git initialization of the note repository failed. This should be a bug.
Error.InitWikiGitRevertErrorDescription: E-2 Not only did the initialization of the note warehouse fail, but also the revocation failed. This is a serious problem, and you need to manually clean up the new folder generated in this location.
Error.InitWikiGitSyncedWikiNoGitUserInfoErrorD: E-6 Initializing the note repository synchronized to the cloud requires you to select a cloud git repository address and provide the certification credentials for the corresponding cloud service. However, this information is not currently available.
Error.InsertMenuAfterSubMenuIndexErrorDescript: E-5 You try to insert menu with afterSubMenu "{{afterSubMenu}}" in menu "{{menuID}}", but we can not found it in menu "{{menu}}", please specific a menuitem with correct id attribute
Error.MainWindowMissing: E-7 This program can't access main window data, can't run normally.
Error.SubWikiSMainWikiNotExistError: The main wiki to which the child wiki is attached does not exist
Error.SubWikiSMainWikiNotExistErrorDescription: A sub-wiki must choose a main wiki to attach to when it is created, but now the main wiki that this sub-wiki should be attached to cannot be found and cannot be attached.
Error.ViewLoadUrlError: E-9 Failed to load the webpage error
Error.ViewLoadUrlErrorDescription: E-9 The Wiki page corresponding to the workspace failed to load, but we will try again soon
Error.WikiRuntimeErrorDescription: E-13 There is an error while running the wiki. Please check the log file for the reason, and upload and submit an issue for repair.
Error.WorkspaceFailedToLoadErrorDescription: E-8 The Wiki page corresponding to the workspace failed to load. There are many reasons, but it is basically because of program bugs.
Error.ZxInitializationError: E-12 Zx code execution service initialization error
Error.ZxInitializationErrorDescription: E-12 Zx code execution service initialization error, please check the log file for the reason, and upload and submit the issue for repair.
Error.ZxInitializationRetryFailedError: E-10 Zx code execution service initialization retry error
Error.ZxInitializationRetryFailedErrorDescript: E-10 Zx code execution service initialization error, the error still fails after repeated retries, please upload the log file and submit an issue to report the error for repair.
Error.ZxNotInitializedError: E-11 Zx code execution service is not initialized error
Error.ZxNotInitializedErrorDescription: E-11 The Zx code execution service is not successfully initialized and will automatically try to initialize.

GitLog.Author: author
GitLog.BinaryFileCannotDisplay: Binary file cannot be displayed as text
GitLog.SelectCommit: Select a submission to view details
GitLog.SelectFileToViewDiff: Select a file to view differences
GitLog.Title: Git history
GitLog.WarningMessage: Note: Checkout and rollback operations will modify workspace files; proceed with caution.

Help.Description:
Clicking the "Open" button will open the page in a new window. The page needs to be loaded from the Internet for the first time (5s - 1min), so it is not available when the network is disconnected. 
You can modify the content of the opened page at will as a sandbox playground to try out the learned features. If you want to save the modified results, you can click Tiddlywiki's save button to save it as a single-page wiki in HTML format.

KeyboardShortcut.HelpText: Press any key combination (e.g., Ctrl+Shift+A). Single modifier keys will be ignored.
KeyboardShortcut.PressKeysPrompt: Please press the shortcut key combination for {{feature}}

Log.AddingFiles: Start Git Add your files that needs backed up
Log.CantForcePullError: Failed to force pull, maybe repo is in special state
Log.CantSyncGitNotInitialized: Unable to sync, this folder is not initialized as a Git repository
Log.CantSyncInSpecialGitStateAutoFixFailed: Unable to Sync, this folder is in special condition, thus can't Sync directly. An auto-fix has been tried, but error still remains. Please resolve all the conflict manually (For example, use VSCode to open the wiki folder), if this still don't work out, please use professional Git tools (Source Tree, GitKraken) to solve this.
Log.CantSyncInSpecialGitStateAutoFixSucceed: This folder is in a special state, it could not be synchronized directly, but it has been automatically repaired
Log.CantSynchronizeAndSyncScriptIsInDeadLoop: Unable to sync, and Sync script is in a dead loop.
Log.CheckingLocalGitRepoSanity: Checking whether the local Git repository is properly initialized
Log.CheckingLocalSyncState: Detecting whether the local state needs to be synchronized to the cloud
Log.GitMergeFailed: Git merge results are not good, there may be loopholes in the merge strategy
Log.GitPushFailed: Git push result is bad, this usually means there is a network issue.
Log.GitTokenExpireOrWrong: The Git credential (Token) has expired and you need to log in again, or the credential does not correspond to the user name
Log.HaveThingsToCommit: There is content that needs to be submitted (commit), and it is being submitted automatically
Log.InitializeWorkspaceView: Initializing workspace and browser view, and loading the web content, please wait
Log.InitializeWorkspaceViewDone: Created successfully, content will be loaded soon
Log.LocalAheadStartUpload: The local state is ahead of the cloud, and the upload starts
Log.LocalStateBehindSync: Local state is behind of the cloud, start merging data from the cloud.
Log.LocalStateDivergeRebase: The local state is divergent from the cloud and begins to rebase (Rebase)
Log.NoNeedToSync: No need to synchronize, the local state is consistent with the cloud
Log.PerformLastCheckBeforeSynchronizationFin: Perform the final check before synchronization ends
Log.PrepareCloneOnlineWiki: Preparing to import an online wiki.
Log.PrepareSync: Prepare to synchronize, use the logged-in author information
Log.RebaseConflictNeedsResolve: Found conflict when performing git Rebase, need to resolve the conflict.
Log.SkipForcePull: Skip force pull, no news from remote
Log.StartBackupToGithubRemote: The local Git where the Wiki is located is being backed up to the Github remote repository. The time required depends on the internet speed, please be patient
Log.StartConfiguringGithubRemoteRepository: After the repository is initialized, start to configure the Github remote repository
Log.StartFetchingFromGithubRemote: Fetching data from the remote Github repository, The time required depends on the internet speed, please be patient.
Log.StartForcePull: Start force pull remote, will completely overwrite local
Log.StartGitInitialization: Start initializing the local Git repository
Log.StartResettingLocalToRemote: Start clearing local and override with remote content
Log.SyncFailedSystemError: Synchronization failed, there may be a problem with the synchronization system
Log.SynchronizationFailed:
Sync failed! 
You need to use tools such as Github Desktop to check the status of the current Git repository. 
The failure may be caused by the network. If this is the case, you can try again after adjusting the network.

Menu.DeveloperToolsActiveWorkspace: Open Developer Tools of Active Workspace
Menu.ExportWholeWikiHTML: Export Whole Wiki as HTML to folder
Menu.RequestFeatureViaGithub: Request a New Feature via GitHub...

Preference.AIGenerateBackupTitleDescription: Use AI to automatically generate Git backup titles based on changes, enabled by default
Preference.AIGenerateBackupTitleTimeoutDescription: Maximum time to wait for AI to generate title, will use default title if timeout
Preference.AlwaysOnTopDetail: Keep TidGi’s main window always on top of other windows, and will not be covered by other windows
Preference.AntiAntiLeech: Some website has Anti-Leech, will prevent some images from being displayed on your wiki, we simulate a request header that looks like visiting that website to bypass this protection.
Preference.AskDownloadLocation: Ask where to save each file before downloading
Preference.ClearBrowsingDataMessage: Are you sure? All browsing data will be cleared. This action cannot be undone.
Preference.ConfirmDeleteExternalApiDatabase: Are you sure you want to delete the database containing external API debug information? This action cannot be undone.
Preference.DefaultUserNameDetail: The user name in the Wiki, this only take effect after restart, this will fill in the creator field of the newly created or edited tiddlers. Can be override by user name set in the workspace setting.
Preference.DisableAntiAntiLeechDetail: Enable this option to completely disable anti-anti-leech functionality.
Preference.DisableAntiAntiLeechForUrlsDetail: Enter one URL per line to only disable anti-anti-leech for these URLs. Because anti-anti-leech feature may cause some websites with anti-anti-anti-leech to be unable to load images.
Preference.HibernateAllUnusedWorkspaces: Hibernate unused workspaces at app launch
Preference.HibernateAllUnusedWorkspacesDescription: Hibernate all workspaces at launch, except the last active workspace.
Preference.HideMenuBarDetail: Hide the menu bar unless the Alt+M is pressed.
Preference.HideSideBarIconDetail: Hide the icon and only display the name of the workspace to make the workspace list more compact
Preference.HowToEnableNotifications: <0>TidGi supports notifications out of the box. But for some cases, to receive notifications, you will need to manually configure additional web app settings.</0><1>Learn more</1><2>.</2>
Preference.MoreWorkspaceSyncSettingsDescription: Please right-click the workspace icon, open its workspace setting by click on "Edit Workspace" context menu item, and configure its independent synchronization settings in it.
Preference.NotificationsMuteAudio: Mute audio when notifications are paused
Preference.OpenLogFolderDetail: When reporting a problem, please open the latest .log file in the folder and send its content to the developer, or paste it to pastebin.com and then paste the URL into the Github Issue
Preference.OpenMetaDataFolder: Open the metadata folder of TidGi workspace
Preference.OpenMetaDataFolderDetail: TiddlyWiki's data and TidGi's workspace metadata are stored separately. TidGi's metadata includes workspace settings, etc., which are stored in this folder in JSON format.
Preference.OpenV8CacheFolderDetail: The V8 cache folder stores cached files that accelerate application startup
Preference.RememberLastVisitState: Remember last page visited, restore last visit state on open
Preference.Reset: Are you sure? All preferences will be restored to their original defaults. Browsing data won't be affected. This action cannot be undone.
Preference.RestorePreferences: Restore preferences to their original defaults
Preference.RunOnBackgroundDetail: When window is closed, Continue to run in the background without exiting. Quickly restore the window when opening the app again.
Preference.RunOnBackgroundDetailNotMac: Recommend to enable Attach To Taskbar. So you can restore window use it.
Preference.SearchEmbeddingDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete all embeddings for workspace "{{workspaceName}}"? This action cannot be undone.
Preference.SearchEmbeddingNoAIConfigError: Please configure AI API settings in the External API section first.
Preference.ShareBrowsingData: Share browsing data (cookies, cache) between workspaces, if this is off, you can login into different 3rd party service in each workspace.
Preference.ShowSideBarDetail: Sidebar lets you switch easily between workspaces.
Preference.ShowTitleBarDetail: Title bar shows you the title of the current page.
Preference.SwipeWithThreeFingersToNavigate: Swipe with three fingers to navigate
Preference.SwipeWithThreeFingersToNavigateDescripti:
Navigate between pages with 3-finger gestures. Swipe left to go back or swipe right to go forward.
To enable it, you also need to change<3>macOS Preferences → TrackPad → More Gestures → Swipe between pageto<5>Swipe with three fingersor<7>Swipe with two or three fingers.
Preference.SyncBeforeShutdownDescription:
Automatically synchronize data before turning off the computer. Note that manually exiting the application will not trigger the synchronization, so as to prevent the wrong data from being synchronized when the application makes an error. 
Windows system does not support this function.
Preference.SyncIntervalDescription: After this length of time, it will automatically start backing up to Github, if is a local workspace it will create a local git backup (take effect after restart app)
Preference.SyncOnlyWhenNoDraft: Sync only when there are no drafts
Preference.SyncOnlyWhenNoDraftDescription:
Check if there are drafts or WYSIWYG editing before synchronizing, if so, it will not be synchronized this time, preventing the drafts from being synchronized to your blog. 
(Not working for sync-before-shutdown, for you may want to bring drafts from one computer to another to continue editing)
Preference.TestNotificationDescription: <0>If notifications dont show up, make sure you enable notifications in<1>macOS Preferences → Notifications → TidGi</1>.</0>
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowAlwaysOnTop: TidGi Mini Window Always on top
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowAlwaysOnTopDetail: Keep TidGi's Mini Window always on top of other windows, and will not be covered by other windows
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowFixedWorkspace: Select workspace for fixed TidGi Mini Window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShortcutKey: Set shortcut key to toggle TidGi Mini Window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShortcutKeyHelperText: Set a shortcut key to quickly open or close TidGi Mini Window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShowSidebar: Attach To TidGi Mini Window Show Sidebar
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShowSidebarTip: Generally, TidGi mini window is only used to quickly view the current workspace, so the default synchronization with the main window workspace, do not need a sidebar, the default hidden sidebar.
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShowTitleBar: Show title bar on TidGi Mini Window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowShowTitleBarDetail: Show draggable title bar on TidGi Mini Window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowSyncWorkspaceWithMainWind: TidGi Mini Window syncs with main window workspace
When checked, TidGi Mini Window will display the same workspace content as main window
Preference.TidgiMiniWindowTip: Make a small TidGi popup window that pop when you click system tray mini icon. Tip: Right-click on mini app icon to access context menu.
Preference.TokenDescription: The credentials used to authenticate to the Git server so you can securely synchronize content. Can be obtained by logging in to storage services (e.g., Github), or manually obtain "personal access token" and filled in here.
Preference.TranslatiumIntro: Translate Any Languages like a Pro
Preference.WebCatalogEngineIntro: WebCatalog is the initial code founder of TidGi, we reuse lots of important code from the open-source WebCatalog, many thanks to WebCatalog and its author Quang Lam
Preference.WebCatalogIntro: Magically turn any websites into cross platform apps. Work more productively and forget about switching tabs.
Preference.WikiMetaDataDescription: Config Wiki metadata likes starting parameters

WorkspaceSelector.AreYouSure:
Are you sure you want to remove this workspace? 
Removing the workspace will delete the workspace in this application, but will not delete the folders from the hard drive. 
But, if you choose to delete the Wiki folder as well, all contents will be deleted.
WorkspaceSelector.RemoveWorkspaceAndDelete: Remove workspace and delete Wiki folder from the disk
